text: Chanyasorn Sakornchan (), nicknamed Fah () (born June 18, 1990) is a Thai beauty queen who currently holds the Miss Thailand Universe 2011 title, and she was a contestant in the Miss Universe 2011 pageant in Sao Paulo, Brazil. ==Biography== Chanyasorn Sakornchan was born and raised in Sattahip, Chonburi. She is the daughter of Lieutenant Commander Suebsamoot Sakornchan who works as an airline pilot for Bangkok Airways and Ratree Tangthamsatit. She received a one-year high school exchange scholarship (OEG High School Exchange USA) from Her Royal Highness Princess Soamsawali of Thailand. She attends Assumption University where she majors in Interior Architecture and Design. She speaks Thai, English and some Japanese. Her hobbies include singing, playing the guitar, dancing and flying Ultralight aviation. ==Pageantry== On March 26, 2011, Sakornchan was crowned Miss Thailand Universe 2011 by Ximena Navarrete, the reigning 2010 Miss Universe from Mexico. As a press favourite, she also won the Miss Photogenic award. The twelfth edition of Miss Thailand Universe pageant was broadcast live from the Royal Paragon Hall, Siam Paragon in Bangkok with two former Miss Universe winners, Apasra Hongsakula, Natalie Glebova and reigning Miss Universe took part as the telecast judges. Chanyasorn represented Thailand at the 2011 Miss Universe pageant held in São Paulo, Brazil. She went unplaced but her costume received second runner-up in the Best Costume Award. ==Stage and screen credits== ===Television (Channel 7)=== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year ! Title !
